explanation: Not correct. MISRA 8.13 advises using const-qualified pointees when the code will not modify the pointed-to object, but you must consider the whole API boundary. metal_dma_unmap simply forwards the sg pointer to dev->bus->ops.dev_dma_unmap whose prototype takes struct metal_sg * (non-const). The wrapper cannot legitimately make its parameter const without either changing the underlying ops prototype or performing a cast (which would discard const and itself violate other rules). Furthermore, there is no evidence here that implementations do not modify the scatter‑gather entries — the ops signature implies they may. The correct remedy, if the entries truly must be immutable, is to change the ops declaration to take const struct metal_sg * (an API change), not to mark only the wrapper const. Therefore the reported violation is incorrect.
